revised_title: The Astronomical Career of James Bradley: Pure Research and Practical Teaching
tldr: The article discusses the life and work of James Bradley, an astronomer who made significant contributions to the field in the 18th century. Bradley is best known for his discoveries of stellar aberration and the nutation of the Earth, which were in line with Newtonian gravitation. The article highlights Bradley's dedication to both pure research and practical teaching, as well as his collaboration with skilled instrument-makers like George Graham.
